cards.title: Vision Card
cards.content:
Best practices for mapping customer needs with business objectives and prioritising delivery.

  • Defining the Problem
  • Setting up for Success
  • Mapping out the Product
  • Launch Platform

cards.title: Execution Card
cards.content:
Case studies demonstrating continuous delivery, validating assumptions and no stop iterations.

  • Integrated UX
  • Scaling Development
  • DevOps Deployments
  • Monitoring

cards.title: Training
cards.content:
Hands on workshops digging into the details of the concepts being discussed at the conference.

  • Jobs to be Done
  • Effective Research Interviews
  • Design Sprints
  • Progressive Web Apps
  • Monitoring Approaches
  • Growth Marketing

cards.title: Merging Design Thinking and DevOps
cards.content: UXDX conf is based around the UXDX model which integrates UX into the Development loop by breaking down the barriers between development, design and research teams.

testimonials.quote: Great insights, generous ideas and plenty of meaty content packed into one dynamic day.
All product builders, all designers and all developers should be here - together. Best content event in Dublin.
testimonials.source: Deirdre Ni Luasaigh, CEO, Culture Ark

testimonials.quote: Too often design and development are considered independent of one another, UXDX shows us that the real magic is in the middle.
Finally we have a holistic view of product development, which includes design.

session.name: Putting the Customer First: Jobs-to-be-Done
session.description: Lean and agile methodologies focus on small batches and quick iterations. But if you don't know what your customers are trying to achieve you are just competing against luck, hoping that one of your gambles will stick. People hire companies to do a job, by focusing on your customer's Jobs-to-be-Done you can be more focused in your iterations and get the elusive product-market fit sooner.

session.name: Value Stream Mapping & the Improvement Kata
session.description: Taking the learnings form Lean manufacturing we can help to improve any process and the products that we are building to support these processes. Mapping the current process focusing on Lead Time, Process Time, and Percent Complete and Accurate. Pick the areas where there is the largest opportunity for improvement.

session.name: Boring Deployments
session.description: Automated, Zero downtime, Hot/Cold, Roll Backs etc.

session.name: Mission Command vs Command and Control
Incremental Metrics: Getting your KPI's Right
session.description:
Breaking down the core metric to be changed into smaller pieces to enable incremental delivery. 

How to do it and examples of it done well

session.name: Your Manage what you Measure: Effective Metrics
Continuous Learning: Feeding UX with Monitoring
The Structure and Tools behind Agile
Fund Raising: What not to do
Planning your Agile Architecture
session.description: Setup decisions: Planning your Agile architecture (Cloud migration path, platform choice, microservices/conainer architecture) ... Before you know everything about your product, how are you supposed to set it up

session.name: Product Audit: New Features vs Increase Existing
session.description: Product Audit: New Features vs Increase Frequency vs Increase Adoption

session.name: UX in API Design
session.description: API Based Architecture - UX in API Design (thinking about your end users)

session.name: Progressive Web Apps: What's in it for the users?
Marketing Features For Adoption
session.description: Marketing Product / Features (Growth Hacking) - Good quote: Eng work on long term growth, marketing on immediate growth

session.name: Continuous User Research that Feeds Development
